messages: 96a0d64ff80ffb5c3b63bc20e102fd9f (07:15): can anyone help me with a problem where I am having very long connect times to a box that until recently was working perfectly
96a0d64ff80ffb5c3b63bc20e102fd9f (07:16): is across a gigabit switch, private network
96a0d64ff80ffb5c3b63bc20e102fd9f (07:16): mytop shows hundreds of authenticating connections that just sort of hang there
96a0d64ff80ffb5c3b63bc20e102fd9f (07:17): is it possible the authentication mechanism is hanging for some reason?
96a0d64ff80ffb5c3b63bc20e102fd9f (07:18): im not running into swap at all
09a56028a63f8e9351a49d2f8c51f8df (07:18): my guess is you're having problems with dns and you aren't running with --skip-name-resolve
96a0d64ff80ffb5c3b63bc20e102fd9f (07:21): would that still cause an issue?
96a0d64ff80ffb5c3b63bc20e102fd9f (07:23): im going to go kill myself now

e01f3f68bdb4a5010fbdbfbbb6e3fa41 (08:12): hey anyone wanna help my mysqld won't start, i'm running gentoo
0e7cf9e3bc3b00cff6628eec9989fc6d (08:15): how can i list anything for host so people can connect from outside the box?
e01f3f68bdb4a5010fbdbfbbb6e3fa41 (08:16): Can't start server : Bind on unix socket: No such file or directory
959a3b8bfebc30a6d9e39795108d5511 (08:17): United: you can't directly with mysql
959a3b8bfebc30a6d9e39795108d5511 (08:18): you bind to a public ip address, then use grants
959a3b8bfebc30a6d9e39795108d5511 (08:18): if that's not enough, you use iptables
924d063f22d66f4efe0e0a3335251530 (08:37): i restart mysql .. and i got this error message --> STOPPING server from pid file /var/run/mysql/mysql.pid
fb9b8a3c7f73cd6d40af260d6bc170c6 (08:37): nothing,  its stops the server then starts it
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:40): ichigo_reloaded, nice name btw, is mysqld running?
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:40): i would check your err file
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:41): which usually resides in your data directory named hostname.err
924d063f22d66f4efe0e0a3335251530 (08:41): thx :) even i restart my slck .. i still got that msg
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:41): is this your fist time using mysql on it?
924d063f22d66f4efe0e0a3335251530 (08:42): yup .. and my 1st time using linux :P
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:43): you have to install the initial database tables
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:43): hold on I'll tell you how to do that as soon as i can remember (look up) the script name
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:44): if your not root all ready
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:45): you should be mysql user now
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:47): you only have to do mysql_install_db when you do a fresh install
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:47): so you should be good to go from now on
7fb8afaf8c37251f55ef60a386c7a664 (08:49): heh i ran into the same problem when i first ran linux (i ran and have been running slackware ever since)
